title: Crates with leading hyphens fail with confusing error messages
body:
```
$ rustc ./-.rs
error: linking with `cc` failed: exit code: 1
note: "cc" '"-Wl,--as-needed"' '"-m64"' '"-L"' '"/usr/lib/rust/rust-nightly/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib"' '"-o"' '"-"' '"-.o"' '"-Wl,--whole-archive"' '"-lmorestack"' '"-Wl,--no-whole-archive"' '"-Wl,--gc-sections"' '"-pie"' '"-nodefaultlibs"' '"/usr/lib/rust/rust-nightly/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libstd-4e7c5e5c.rlib"' '"/usr/lib/rust/rust-nightly/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libcollections-4e7c5e5c.rlib"' '"/usr/lib/rust/rust-nightly/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libunicode-4e7c5e5c.rlib"' '"/usr/lib/rust/rust-nightly/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/librand-4e7c5e5c.rlib"' '"/usr/lib/rust/rust-nightly/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/liballoc-4e7c5e5c.rlib"' '"/usr/lib/rust/rust-nightly/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/liblibc-4e7c5e5c.rlib"' '"/usr/lib/rust/rust-nightly/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libcore-4e7c5e5c.rlib"' '"-L"' '"/usr/lib/rust/rust-nightly/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib"' '"-L"' '"/home/chris/.rust/lib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu"' '"-L"' '"/home/chris/lib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu"' '"-Wl,--whole-archive"' '"-Wl,-Bstatic"' '"-Wl,--no-whole-archive"' '"-Wl,-Bdynamic"' '"-ldl"' '"-lpthread"' '"-lrt"' '"-lgcc_s"' '"-lpthread"' '"-lc"' '"-lm"' '"-lcompiler-rt"'
note: cc: error: unrecognized command line option ‘-.o’

error: aborting due to previous error
```

`rustc` passes the crate name to `cc` verbatim, so the leading hyphen is treated as an option.

I think the best solution would be to ban leading hyphens altogether, since there's no real use case for these shenanigans.
